column1: As the Thanksgiving approaches & #COVID19 cases continue to rise we must remember to follow the CDC recommended guidelines. If you’re attending or hosting a Thanksgiving gathering read these considerations from the @CDCgov on family gatherings: https://t.co/OuzHCkQcTu
More great #COVID19 vaccine news! #OperationWarpSpeed is helping deliver vaccines in record time. https://t.co/dUQpWCqqnE

Congratulations to the 40 cadets that graduated from the Mountaineer ChalleNGe Academy!   Despite the challenges of #COVID19 their hard work and dedication has payed off.  (1/2)  https://t.co/SAOYZQhOZR

Understandably our nation has focused on #COVID but the opioid epidemic is still raging across America. We can’t ignore the opioid epidemic and must build on the work we’ve done in the past to improve access to treatment and stop deadly drugs from flooding our communities.
🚨 Free #Covid_19 testing locations! ⬇️  https://t.co/Cfe1H4MbAg
Important update on #OperationWarpSpeed!  ⁦@moderna_tx early data shows its #Covid_19 vaccine is 94.5% effective! https://t.co/iAzelDyzTY
🚨New #COVID19 restrictions https://t.co/eWzczYdgGu
Exciting news the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine is 90% effective!   This news is a testament to American innovation and drive to develop a #COVID19 vaccine.  https://t.co/kGJRNKjS0N
For #COVID19 testing locations ⬇️ https://t.co/StO0jtGdNh
H.R. 6877 The bill requires HHS to issue a report to Congress on all State local Tribal and territorial requests for supplies from the Strategic National Stockpile (SNS) related to COVID-19.

Many Americans are being denied coverage for #COVID19 testing. Cost should not be a barrier for those who want to be tested. That's why @BillPascrell & I sent a bipartisan letter asking @HHSGov to make changes so those who need tests can get them. https://t.co/82y2qTSOXz

NEWS: I led a letter to @SecAzar expressing concerns over recent changes to the Provider Relief Fund reporting requirements which change how health care providers document lost revenue as a result of the #COVID19 pandemic. 1/2  https://t.co/tHyqOPcqH4
Free #COVID19 testing in Wood County on October 24th! https://t.co/36AZVKJu2S
Stopped by @MisterBeeChips while in Wood county. We discussed the impact of #COVID__19 on small businesses. https://t.co/D1ZIkC8KKM

The White House offered @SpeakerPelosi rapid #COVID tests however she declined. Since then Members of Congress have contracted #COVID19 & many more have been forced to quarantine.  It's time the House implements a testing program for Members of Congress & essential staff. https://t.co/9dNmgMRWjK

#ICYMI: I hosted a virtual roundtable with @SeemaCMS & health care providers from #WV.  It was a great opportunity to hear the real-world impact of the policies Congress & the Trump Administration have implemented in responding to #COVID19 .  https://t.co/lQeFNPIvIz

September's #JobsReport marks the 5th straight month of unemployment decline since the start of #COVID19.  We still have a long way to go but we’re making progress rebuilding our economy.  https://t.co/ZfhQafMVZj

This investment is vital in helping WV small businesses rebuild & recover from the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. Small businesses are the heart of our communities and their success is essential to our economic growth. (2/2)  More ⬇️ https://t.co/6C46VRS6dc
This morning I hosted a meeting with local health departments & the @Surgeon_General. Dr. Adams discussed with us the progress of the COVID-19 vaccine. https://t.co/LQevo1g8FG

We're facing two crises at once -- the #COVID19 pandemic & the addiction epidemic that is claiming thousands of lives each year. This #RecoveryMonth I'm wearing purple to show my support for those in recovery & spread awareness that help is available. #CongressGoesPurple https://t.co/BqM8ZMaq6S
#OperationWarpSpeed is working to deliver a safe and effective #Covid_19 vaccine to the American people in record time. https://t.co/nkvWkdcvXT

Yet again Democrats block a relief bill that would help countless Americans struggling with the impacts of the coronavirus pandemic.    This is getting ridiculous. It's time to stop playing political games and put Americans first. https://t.co/Gy5FoSkCLK

Today is #WorldSuicidePreventionDay. These past few months more Americans have reported feeling depressed during #COVID19.  If you or someone you love needs help please call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-8255. https://t.co/BfOg9L2twt

EXCITING NEWS! This is a step in the right direction in working to close the digital divide for students as many schools adapt to remote and hybrid learning classrooms amid #Covid_19. https://t.co/BL171ziwhR

Dr. Breen was a hero in every sense of the word. She dedicated her life to saving others & answered the call in battling the COVID19 pandemic. This legislation will continue her life’s work and ensure her legacy is never forgotten. (2/2)  https://t.co/YeRObK0hEe

ICYMI: I joined my colleagues in an effort to help prevent suicide burnout & mental health conditions among healthcare professionals. By supporting our healthcare workers we can ensure they are staying mentally healthy while continuing to fight the COVID19 pandemic. (1/2)

September is #SuicidePreventionMonth. These past few months more Americans have reported feeling depressed during #COVID19.  If you or someone you love needs help please call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 1-800-273-8255. https://t.co/PHDBKVLoFX

A healthcare themed day! I visited @MonHealth then met for lunch with the w/ the Director of the Clay Battelle clinic & after discussed the impacts of #Covid_19  w/ @claymarsh.   Now wrapping up the day with an interview w/ @WBOY12News before traveling back to Wheeling. https://t.co/ST6JSLZYeN

This is great news! The #PaycheckProtectionProgram is saving countless jobs and giving small businesses a boost.   We still have a long way to go but we’re making progress rebuilding our economy. #COVID__19 https://t.co/HaWFhc7qUj
Thank you @POTUS for taking action to help support workers who are unemployed due to #COVID19.  https://t.co/Cf5tkfYFiT

Thank you @SecretaryRoss & @US_EDA for awarding $4.3 million in #CARESAct Recovery Assistance grants to support communities across #WV.   These investments are vital in helping #WV small businesses respond & recover from the impact of #COVID19.   https://t.co/PAebpPjYE4

Really? Speaker Pelosi just said "I don't think that there should be any debates."   Canceling the debates would be unfair to the voters.   Maybe she should spend less time trolling Meadows & the President & more focused on solutions for #COVID19.  https://t.co/xUw3GLHeVd

Full day. Started off w/ a meeting w/ Marion County Commissioner then visited small businesses to discuss issues they are facing amid #COVID19 next I met with USPS employees to listens to their concerns over mail service & now I am traveling back to Wheeling. More tomorrow! #WV https://t.co/Rh3I0JYMkD

In recent weeks we have:  ✅Signed onto a bipartisan letter to the Postmaster General opposing cuts to service; ✅Sponsored a bipartisan amendment to return service to its previous level; ✅Publicly stated support for including funding for the USPS in a Covid relief bill.  (2/4)

Enoch Shelter is one of my favorite views overlooking the city of Parkersburg especially on a beautiful day. Today I met with local officials to discuss the #COVID19 pandemic and how to help towns recover. https://t.co/6D75LS7tEP
Join me in celebrating #WorldMaskWeek. Wearing a mask social distancing and washing your hands can protect your loved ones and help prevent the spread of #COVID19. #MaskUpWV https://t.co/AZONZeR69s
As we celebrate #NationalHealthCenterWeek I would like to say thank you to all the healthcare heroes for serving our communities especially during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/pyVMZBGpfS
🚨 #COVID__19 testing locations this weekend https://t.co/MrbUi34fVK
I spoke with Jim Matuga on @PositivelyWV_ this morning on issues facing small business owners and what I hope to see in the next #COVID19 package. #positivelywv  Watch here⬇️: https://t.co/0gFPhuhGPF
Recovered from #COVID19? Your plasma has antibodies that can help others fight the virus. Volunteer and donate your plasma.  Find a donation center: https://t.co/CdDCjC1em6. https://t.co/HUyBJP7z56
📢Free #COVID19 testing in Marion County on August 1st. https://t.co/UBgOeMKWNh

🚨BIG NEWS: The @FTA_DOT awarded West Virginia University $2500543 in #CARESAct funding. The grant will support operating administrative and preventive maintenance costs in order to respond and recover from the #COVID19 public health crisis.

Miners already work in tough conditions COVID-19 only increases the need for stronger safety protections for these miners. That's why @RepCartwright & I introduced a bill that ensures reasonable workplace safety standards to protect miners from COVID-19.  https://t.co/y8NfPpLuDc
🚨 HAPPENING now @HouseCommerce is holding a hearing on efforts to develop a #COVIDー19 vaccine.   #TuneIn here 📺: https://t.co/cGJp2KwoBH https://t.co/7Zc8uuNU8w
Hosted a zoom meeting with West Virginia superintendents to discuss what the upcoming school year will look like due to the #COVID__19 pandemic. https://t.co/ZOxEx8PCIY

COVID19 has demonstrated that we depend on foreign suppliers far too much for products.  Yet in another sector of our economy that is vital to our national security energy. We are about to plunge blindly into a similar reliance on foreign sources. Haven’t we learned? https://t.co/j7F3qp194Z
🚨More testing locations in Barbour Harrison and Mercer counties on July 14 16 and 17 2020. #Covid #testing https://t.co/D0vfYZhRhl

The stresses covid has put on the supply chain for lifesaving drugs & personal protective equipment have shown we can’t rely on China and other foreign suppliers for critical needs. America should not make the same mistakes with clean energy. #SupplyChain  https://t.co/5JITQE3DrF

I am proud to introduce the TREATS Act w/ @RepTedBudd @davidcicilline & @RepDavidTrone. Overdoses are on the rise across the country due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Congress should be making it easier to access treatment.  Read More ⬇️. https://t.co/aYv4yzsfKy

West Virginia is fighting two public health crises — COVID19 and addiction. I'm proud to join @RepHarley and @RepTedBudd to introduce the bipartisan Drug-Free Communities Pandemic Relief Act to ensure treatment coalitions can continue to operate and save lives during #COVID19. https://t.co/4deKuF2h4C

Happy Independence Day! This holiday is another reminder of the ways we’ve all had to adjust and rework communal celebrations and gatherings in the age of COVID-19. Remember to follow the CDC recommendations & social distancing guidelines. Enjoy this 4th of July weekend! https://t.co/2U1xniDtud

🚨BREAKING NEWS: @CommerceGov awarded #WV $4.4 million from the #CARESAct!   Congress passed the CARES Act to help our economy get back on track. These investments will help in recovery from COVID-19 and promote economic development in communities across the state.
🚨Tomorrow @WV_DHHR and the Harrison-Clarksburg Health Departent are offering free COVID-19 testing in Clarksburg. https://t.co/0DF2YLfoaO
🚨HUGE NEWS: The @NBA will be using the OURA ring that @WVUHealth found can detect #COVID__19  symptoms days earlier. https://t.co/9BdcUy3Jye
Back in Washington to participate in the virtual  @HouseCommerce hearing on the #COVID19 impact on the energy sector. https://t.co/VRZuSLfE6t
Great news! The West Virginia National Guard have been a tremendous help during the #COVID19 pandemic. Glad to see the President is extending the Title 32 orders.  https://t.co/6HlWmlYIkd

As we celebrate #NationalEMSWeek let’s take a moment to honor the efforts from our first responders who are on the front lines battling the #Covid_19 pandemic! Thank you for all that you do in our communities! https://t.co/6xDJZiVcV9

Thanks to @POTUS and Congress West Virginia healthcare workers were supplied with more #PPE to protect themselves and others from #COVID19 ensuring we can continue reopening safely! https://t.co/lAKE0gXGh0

Democrats released a 1800+ page wish list costing over $3 trillion that includes various items that have nothing to do with the #COVID19 pandemic. We need a bipartisan approach to move forward not political point scoring. https://t.co/qJpRT5FTI2

🚨BREAKING NEWS: The Mid-Ohio Valley Transit Authority was awarded $2.4 million of Federal Transit Administration funds through the #CARESAct. The grant funding can be used to respond to and recover from the #Covid_19 public health emergency.

This #NationalPoliceWeek I would like to recognize West Virginia's law enforcement for protecting and serving our communities. Thank you for keeping us safe during the #COVID19 pandemic and year-round. https://t.co/TWy1zvAk4m

🚨🚨The BOP confirmed there will be no more prisoner transfers to FCI Gilmer and FCI Hazelton during the #COVID-19 pandemic. Thankfully they reconsidered their ill-advised plan and backed off. Given the outbreaks in federal prisons around the country the transfer of... (1/3)
🚨 BREAKING NEWS: West Virginia is receiving over $9.8 million for #COVID19 testing at community health centers. To read more click⬇️ https://t.co/qyio8mfdLW
Thank you @IPRCenter #HSI agents for continuing to investigate #Covid_19 scams. https://t.co/A5vurYYOKQ

On #NationalDayofPrayer let’s join in prayer for those who we have lost and those who are sick. Let’s also pray for the health care workers & first responders who are on the front lines battling #Covid_19. https://t.co/EBLHd4QlTO
Enjoyed speaking at the 49th East Fuel Buyers Virtual Conference this morning to discuss the impact of #Covid_19 on the energy industry. https://t.co/jJ2byH8qwV

As part of the front-line workers battling #COVID19 nursing professionals need our support now more than ever. Thank you for all of your hard work and sacrifices you are making during this time. #NurseAppreciationWeek https://t.co/AneE7jX2Lx
I will continue to support postal workers and ensure the service many West Virginians count on continues especially during #COVID19. https://t.co/zV5r3PIFsD

When #COVID19 is over @WVtourism will be waiting to welcome our visitors. Until then you can take a #VirtualRoadTrip across the US which includes a stop in #WV at 12:30pm tomorrow! #SpiritOfTravel #nttw20  Learn more➡️https://t.co/8mUMT8Bj4X https://t.co/5ZOqP0D2qx
Tune in tonight at 5 pm on @wchs8fox11 to hear the latest information on what legislation Congress is working on to help combat #COVID19. Link below. ⬇️ https://t.co/i7MROOoLEL
Glad to see @kroger stepping up during #COVID19 ! https://t.co/tkpmiMN6mw

Connectivity is even more vital right now – to stay in touch with family and friends work remotely educate our children and access entertainment. Glad to see these companies stepping up during #COVID19.  https://t.co/PaX2F896lw

It is important we work to combat #COVIDー19 related fraud and other crimes. Thank you #HSI agents for what you do! https://t.co/67vGc2qyk8

Yesterday I spoke with the @WVaChamber and small businesses on addressing the lack of @SBAgov loans available to them. We must keep our small businesses doors open by passing #PPP and other #COVID19 relief resources. https://t.co/eiTVS5YmrK

Proud to join @RepJasonSmith in sending a letter to leadership to voice our idea on forgiving funds paid to hospitals through the CMS Accelerated and Advance Payment Program. It is important we protect patients access to healthcare and preserve rural hospitals during #COVID19. https://t.co/7We5dTFcSx

The social distancing and closures of non-essential businesses are apparently working in WV.  The IMHE projections of deaths from COVID by August have been lowered again.  Initially they forecast nearly 500 then 103 now 74.  Your personal sacrifices are working.  Thank you.

🚨🚨BREAKING NEWS: West Virginia hospitals are receiving almost $250 million from the first round of the #CARESAct funding. Health care professionals are on the front-lines battling #COVID19 and are providing essential care and treatment to patients.

On #WorldHeathDay I want to ⁠thank all of our doctors nurses and healthcare professionals across the country and especially those here in WV who are on the front lines battling #COVID19. We are grateful for everything that you do! https://t.co/jPc9xC0ltR

Yesterday @realDonaldTrump approved @WVGovernor's request for federal assistance for battling #Covid_19 in West Virginia. Earlier this week the entire WV delegation sent a letter to the President supporting this request. https://t.co/TaTLvbgQcN

Last thing Americans need to worry about are robocallers. The @FCC posted tips on how to stay safe from #COVID19 scam callers. https://t.co/qwxHRmORAT

I will be hosting a telephone townhall with experts on the line to answer questions on #COVID19 for WV District One. If you have questions or want to listen in the townhall will start at 4:45 pm. For more information visit my FB page for the call in number and instructions.

Last night it was confirmed WV has its first #COVID19 case. Mary & I made phone calls to Hospital Administrators & staff in the district to ask what they are implementing to combat the virus. If you have any questions or concerns call @WV_DHHR hotline 1-800-887-4304. https://t.co/Viag0YqErn

Spent the past two days conferring with hospitals in WV and will continue tomorrow.  As we formulate plans to address both the coronavirus impact on healthcare and an economic recovery plan for workers families and small businesses Congress has to get it right.  We’re listening

Following these recommendations from the @CDCgov will help slow the spread of #COVID19. Keep practicing social distancing and washing your hands! https://t.co/XhQCt2GERN

Wheeling Hospital is offering #COVIDー19 testing at an off site location. If you are experiencing symptoms and have not yet been tested call the hospital’s on-call number to make an appointment! https://t.co/cnVsWBXSVJ
The @WhiteHouse and @CDCgov  came out today with important information regarding how to slow the spread of the #Covid_19.  Here are the latest guidelines posted: https://t.co/vrLiizEcHm

Late last night the House overwhelmingly passed legislation to expand access to testing and provide economic support to families and businesses impacted by #COVIDー19  with bipartisan support. Free tests and paid sick leave are vital to help Americans respond to this crisis (1/3)

During this time of uncertainty its important to rely on experts for information and advice. The @CDC is a key resource and provides the most up-to-date information on the #Covid_19.   https://t.co/wkZWI4ZrpA

The @CDC recommends washing your hands for at least 20 seconds to help stop the spread of the #COVID2019. Instead of singing Happy Birthday the chorus of Country Roads is just about that long! https://t.co/FT8RVIVPw2

As the public deals with the “unknowns” of the coronavirus yesterday’s briefing by the US Surgeon General Adams on his findings revealed: “The average age of death is age 80.... you’re more likely to die from the flu if you get it than to die from coronavirus.”  Be safe.
WV Department Health and Human Resources is now equipped for testing and established a hotline for questions from the public and medical providers concerning #COVID19 . https://t.co/rAzKkgkYuI

Closely monitoring the Coronavirus and encourage everyone to follow the CDC’s recommendations on how to help prevent the spread of the #Covid_19. For updated information please visit the @CDCgov and @CDCemergency websites. https://t.co/zaUI8Cpg4L

Given the growing global threat from the spreading coronavirus from China isn’t it time that the President designate a czar within his Administration to establish protocols to control the disease in America.  There is precedence to go forward with this.
